answers.answer: The midwife sent me to get the test for gestational diabetes too.  I felt so stupid -- all the other women were wayyy further along than me in the waiting room.Watch out!  That sugary drink is *SUGARY* ugh.  :)I've read a lot of horror stories about c-sections on the net, but everyone I know personally has had it come out just fine!  It's so common these days.  Make sure you trust your doctor and your facility.  I wouldn't worry about the rest.  It'll be a short l & d for you!

Aren't we the lucky ones :-O)Actually I already did the glucose fasting test a couple of years ago so I think the gestational diabetes test is going to be the same kind of idea. ALTHOUGH having said that I didn't used to have to eat every couple of hours then so this should be interesting.From what I gather about c-sections if they're planned you probably have a slightly easier time than if you go into labour for a while then it turns out you need an emerg c-section.  It's just such a longer recovery ...... although having said that my girlfriend had a normal l&d but ended up with an episiotomy that she said the recovery for that wasn't a barrel of laughs either.  My other girlfriend had 3 c's (1 emerg due to breach then the next 2 planned due to breach) I'll have to pick her brains about tips & tricks for recovery.We really can't win.

I am glad to hear that baby is doing well.  Every appointment that you get news, is a good one.  things change so often when it comes to the birth it is hard to prepare in advance!  Mentally prepare for anything!!  No matter how much you prepare there is always something that will shock you.  I am not looking forward to the GD drink this time!  dont envy either of you at this moment.

C-sections aren't so bad.  I had one with Gavin and I will be having one again with John Matt.  Send me a message and explain to me what is going on with your health.  I need to pray for you specifically.Julie

However you give birth, just take it as it comes! I think it'd be fair to at least let you TRY to give birth vaginally but also know that a c-section is most likely and go in with a good attitude.I have to have the glucose test every trimester. I passed the first one (I took it when I was around 8 weeks). You do drink the Glucola or whatever they give you (I had "Fruit Punch"--- so nasty!).

Thanks Gals,Well she didn't say I couldn't have a natural birth it just all have to occur before my due date :-O) Not sure what the odds of that are exactly. Although, I personally was actually born on my due date.I've had high bp since I was 27 (been on medication since and now am on aldomet considered one of the safer ones during pregnancy, and have been tagged as pre-diabetic for the last four years. And I'm in my advanced maternal years......lovely.So we're hoping that my blood pressure remains stable and that I don't get hit with pre-eclampsia and that I don't develop gestational diabetes because of my insulin resistance issues.....plus I'm overweight but I am being very careful about weight gain during pregnancy.Joanne

question: So,I had my first appointment with my ob, previously I had been seen by the maternity clinic in the hospital (10 doctors that share the baby delivering duties - whoevers on call) they ordered my quad screen, toxo tests, prenatal screening testsOf course the only time my bp has been bad since getting pregnant is while in her office - 3 times in a row - so she upped my bp meds. Urgh. I'm supposed to be tracking and logging it now. She's also going to be sending me for my gestational diabetes screen next month I think - about a month or two earlier than the regular person goes?She let me know that there's now way with my health issues and potential issues that we'll be going one minute over my due date which she moved up by a day, now its October 19th. I'm to prepare myself mentally for a c-section.I've always thought I would have a c-section but lately I've been preparing myself mentally for a v-birth so now I'm back to preparing for a c-section. I told her about my sister's birth and I think that sealed the deal....my sister had a 12lb10oz baby boy, where she was overdue, induced, in labour forever then they figure out oops, he can't come out so we'll do a c-section...... my nan told my sister the gals in the family have BIG babies. nightmare.One positive note is that I got to hear the heartbeat and send a recording to my hubby. It was 165. It was funny she said its hit and miss and usually she misses but she found it on first attempt almost.
title: Had my First OB Appt @ 12 Weeks
